verbs.description: irrigate (third-person singular simple present irrigates, present participle irrigating, simple past and past participle irrigated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To supply (farmland) with water, by building ditches, pipes, etc.
examples: We need to irrigate the land before we plant the crops.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To clean (a wound) with a fluid.
examples: The nurse will show you how to irrigate the wound to prevent infection.
